title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain why a power company would choose wind energy rather than hydroelectric energy to replace electricity generation by fossil fuels, such as any of the following:

· The initial investment for wind energy is lower because wind energy turbine production and installation is less expensive than site-specific hydroelectric dam construction.

· Hydroelectric energy requires a river, which limits where the power company can build dams, whereas wind turbines can be placed in a wider range of locations, giving the power company more options.

· Hydroelectric energy facilities can be impacted by drought, so in regions where long-term climate conditions include both ample winds and periodic drought, the power company would choose wind energy as a more consistent/reliable source of energy than hydroelectric power.

· Hydroelectric power plants can impact water flow/riparian habitats/aquatic environments whereas wind turbines do not so a power company in a region with high value aquatic areas would likely choose wind power.

· As wind energy becomes more and more prevalent (in demand), the cost of building, installing and maintaining will be less than old technologies such as hydroelectric making wind a better financial choice for the power company.
